td.p: Sums the quanitity requested by the cost price per unit.
Provides a percentage that describes what deviation that is less than the number ordered will be considered acceptable by both parties, if any such deviation is allowed.
Provides a percentage that describes what deviation that is more than the number ordered will be considered acceptable by both parties, if any such deviation is allowed.
Country Codes are unique alphabetic Codes used to identify every country within the FSS Online system.
Country Codes are unique alphabetic Codes used to identify every country within the FSS Online system.
Select Fair Opportunity Act when needed.
Identifies the number of days ther ordering entity has to accept the shipment.
Identifies the Administrative Contracting Office associated with the Contract.
Code used to identify the Administrative Contracting Office responsible for the Purchase Order.
Identifies the Administrative Contracting Office responsible for the Contract.
In simple terms, this Code idenitifies the availability of stock and the method of acquisition, (requisition, fabrication, assembly, or local purchase).
Allows you to increase or descrease the project value.
The Office responsible for the administration of the Contract.
Agency Code from the Customer Address File (CAF).
Identifies the Agency that the Project targets.
Used to control the allocation of Stock Contracts in the Order Writing process.

Buyer Codes are unique two-character, alphanumeric identifiers associated with each individual in GSA who has buying authority. Typically, Buyer Codes take the form of the individual’s first and last name initials. Here, you may enter an alternate buyer code if necessary.
Indicates whether or not ARRA is applicable to the Contract and the associated Mod.
This specifies the number of days after receipt of Order which which the Inspection must take place.
Identifies the applicable American Recovery and Reinvestment Act Treasury Account Symbol.
The Buyer amd Supervisor to whom the Mod will be Assigned.
Used to attach supporting documentation to the Modification.
The date on which the Contract was Awarded.
The date on which the Contract was Awarded.
Location where the Contract has been Awarded. The location is based on the FIPS table.
Provide the FIPS Code of the Awarded, Principal Place of Performance.
The date on which the Contract becomes Effective.
Identifies the first year the Project is expected to receive Funding.
Identifies the Contractor's legal business name, or if it is doing business under another name.

Select the appropriate Buyer Code. Buyer Codes are unique two-character, alphanumeric identifiers associated with each individual in GSA who has buying authority. Typically, Buyer Codes take the form of the individual’s first and last name initials.

Where applicable, will identify the type of Stock or SOP Program against which the Contract is being made.

Buyer Codes are unique two-character, alphanumeric identifiers associated with each individual in GSA who has buying authority. Typically, Buyer Codes take the form of the individual’s first and last name initials.
Identifies the Reporting/Acquisition Center responsible for Requisition processing.
Any notes regarding what this Modification is about.
Provides the notes from the CID associated with the Modification.

FAS established a transformational process for MAS Contract Administration: the establishment of Central Intake Desks (CID). A CID is located at each MAS Acquisition Center for the receipt of all incoming Paper and Email Modification Requests.

Certificates of Competency (CoC) are used when a small business may be Awarded a Contract, but has also received unfavorable past performance ratings, or did not pass its Repsonsibility Determination. CoCs are obtained from the SBA and serve to vouch for the responsibility of that small business to be Awarded a Contract.
Idenitifies whether the Contract is related to Contingency, Humanitarian, or Peacekeeping Operations.

Vendor submitting contract proposals under the General Services Administration's Multiple Award Schedules (MAS) Program may specify Exception to a Solicitation Clause. The PCO may Approve, Reject or Request Clarification for a particular Clause Exception.

Vendor submitting contract proposals under the General Services Administration's Multiple Award Schedules (MAS) Program may specify Exception to a Solicitation Clause. The PCO may Approve, Reject or Request Clarification for a particular Clause Exception.

The Clinger-Cohen Act (CCA) directed the development and maintenance of Information Technology Architectures (ITAs) by federal agencies to maximize the benefits of informantion technology within the government.

The Clinger-Cohen Act (CCA) directed the development and maintenance of Information Technology Architectures (ITAs) by federal agencies to maximize the benefits of informantion technology within the government.
Indicates whether the successful Offeror is currently a small business.
Indicates whether a commercially available Item that is being Procured.
Select a Contract Indicator to tailor your search results.
Identify the type of contract that you are entering. Note that MAS Contracts should be loaded from ORS, not entered directly into FSS Online.
Several windows/screens in the Client Server Application, FSS Online within the PR module used to load and display Contract information including Vendor Clause Exceptions.
Depending on your selected Contract Indicator, this field will change; it will populate based on your selections in the Solicitation Number field.
Identifies whether Report results, or search results will display Schedule or Non-Schedule Contract types.
Refers to both Contracting Officers and Contracting Specialists access and review electronic offers (e-Offers) and Modifications (e-Mods) submitted by Vendors via the FSS-19 system.
Identifies the Contractor's DUNS number. Must be registered in SAM (formerly CCR) and have an active account.
Allows some users to make minor edits to a Contract.
Identifies the per-Unit Cost of each Item.
Usually the full text name of a particular country.
Provides the two-character Country Code of where the Company hails from.
Dangerous Article Codes are taken from the federal government's Hazadous Material Table and used to identify goods that pose various risks to consumers, (e.g. toxicity, corrosivesness, etc.).
Will be displayed if GSA Initiated the Mod - please enter the date that GSA Initiated the Modification.
Will be displayed if the Contractor requested the Mod - please enter the date you received the Modification Request.
Allows some users to make minor edits to a Contract.
Select the date that the Products/Services under the PO will be delivered.
Description of the Mod (SF-30 Form - Block 14)
The information entered in this textbox will be displayed on the Contractor's SF-30 in Block 14; it is intended to provide a brief description of the Contract Modification.
Identifies the percentage discount if the invoice is paid within a specified number of days.
Identifies the percentage discount if the invoice is paid within a specified number of days. Note that this field must have a lower percentage and higher number of days than the Discount 1 field.
Identifies the number of days in which the Order invoice must be paid.
Should be completed if the Contractor uses a name other than its legal business name in its dealings.
Identifies the highest Contract dollar amount the user can sign off on.
Indicates whether the successful Offeror is a domestically owned or foreign owned entity.

The Data Universal Numbering System, (abbreviated as DUNS® or D-U-N-S®), is a system developed and regulated by Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) that assigns a unique numeric identifier, referred to as a "DUNS number," to a single business entity.

The Data Universal Numbering System, (abbreviated as DUNS® or D-U-N-S®), is a system developed and regulated by Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) that assigns a unique numeric identifier, referred to as a "DUNS number," to a single business entity.
Not required, but provides the DUNS number associated with the company's location where Orders/Requisitions will be sent, if different than the company's main address.
Allows some users to make minor edits to a Contract.

Electronic Contract Management System: This system enables paperless process for Solicitations, Vendor Submission of Proposals, Bid Evaluation, Award Determination, Contract writing, Contract Management processes, as well as establishing and enforcing standard Acquisition practices and policies department-wide.

Electronic Contract Management System: This system enables paperless process for Solicitations, Vendor Submission of Proposals, Bid Evaluation, Award Determination, Contract writing, Contract Management processes, as well as establishing and enforcing standard Acquisition practices and policies department-wide.

Electronic Contract Management System: This system enables paperless process for Solicitations, Vendor Submission of Proposals, Bid Evaluation, Award Determination, Contract writing, Contract Management processes, as well as establishing and enforcing standard Acquisition practices and policies department-wide.
This is the date the Modification will become Active against the Contract.
The date the Contract is scheduled to end.
Identifies the last year the Project is expected to receive Funding.

eOffer/eMod web-based applications that allow companies to electronically prepare and submit Contract Proposals and Contract Modifications under the General Services Administration's Multiple Award Schedules (MAS) Program. The General Services Administration launched eOffer and eMod as the paperless means to streamline the Contract Award and Modification processes in May and July of 2004, respectively.

eOffer/eMod web-based applications that allow companies to electronically prepare and submit Contract Proposals and Contract Modifications under the General Services Administration's Multiple Award Schedules (MAS) Program. The General Services Administration launched eOffer and eMod as the paperless means to streamline the Contract Award and Modification processes in May and July of 2004, respectively.

eOffer/eMod web-based applications that allow companies to electronically prepare and submit Contract Proposals and Contract Modifications under the General Services Administration's Multiple Award Schedules (MAS) Program. The General Services Administration launched eOffer and eMod as the paperless means to streamline the Contract Award and Modification processes in May and July of 2004, respectively.
Identifies whether the Procurement involves any Products that the EPA has flagged.
Provides an estimate of the extent to which Shipping Costs will be required of the Requisition.
Identifies the estimated price for this NSN.
This is a Solicitation value and cannot be changed after the Contract is loaded.
If Full and Open Competition was not used, this field identifies the justification for not providing such competition, (e.g., limited sources, urgent requirement, etc.).
GSA Federal Acquisition Service - Chief Information Officer.
Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps) - Is a GSA operated website that contains all federal solicitation information.
Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps) - Is a GSA operated website that contains all federal solicitation information.
Identifies the type of fee and percentage associated with an agency's use of this Contract.
Enter information if there is a Flat Fee associated with making this Purchase.
Allows some users to make minor edits to a Contract.
FOB specifies which party (Buyer or Seller) pays for which Shipment and Loading Costs, and/or where responsibility for the goods is transferred.
FOB specifies which part (Buyer or Seller) pays for which Shipment and Loading Costs, and/or where responsibility for the goods is transferred.

Federal Procurement Data System - Next Generation (FPDS-NG): This system stores Contract and Order information. FAS automatically transmits all legacy FSS records regardless of value. Every Modification to that Contract and/or Order must be report to the FPDS-NG system. FPDS-NG's data are used to create recurring and special Reports to the President, Congress, Government Accountability Office, federal executive agencies, and the general public. It is extremely important that data contained in FPDS-NG is accurate, complete, and submitted in a timely manner.

Federal Procurement Data System - Next Generation (FPDS-NG): This system stores Contract and Order information. FAS automatically transmits all legacy FSS records regardless of value. Every Modification to that Contract and/or Order must be report to the FPDS-NG system. FPDS-NG's data are used to create recurring and special Reports to the President, Congress, Government Accountability Office, federal executive agencies, and the general public. It is extremely important that data contained in FPDS-NG is accurate, complete, and submitted in a timely manner.

Formatted Price List: Piloted by Financial And Business Solutions (FABS) schedule 520, part of an initiative by GSA to streamline the Electronic Price List process, and to create a database in which Customer Agencies can search for their desired services and compare pricing.

Federal Strategic Sourcing Initiative: The result of a partnership between GSA and the US Department of Treasury, responding to an Office of Management and Budget and Office of Federal Procurement Policy Request requiring all Agencies to identify Commodities to be Purchased more efficiently through strategic sourcing.
Will likely be auto-populated based on prior entries - Indicates the Agency that is providing the Funding for the Initiative.
Will likely be auto-populated based on prior entries - Indicates the Office that is providing Funding for the Initiative.
Enter the Fiscal Year assocated with the Contract.
Provides details associated with the Requisition's use of the General Supply Fund.
Indicates whether government furnished property or equipment has been or will be provided to the Contractor in order to execute the Contract.
Allows some users to make minor edits to a Contract.
Provides details associated with the Requisition's use of the General Supply Fund.
Instructional Letter 2011-09 was memo released by the GSA Office of Acquisition Management outlining new instructions for the implementation of the Requirement for Subcontracting Plans.
Indicates where the Product being shipped will be inspected.
Identifies the type of inspection that will be performed upon delivery of the Product.
International Organization of Standardization (ISO) ISO 3166 is the international standard for country codes and codes for their subdivisions.
Freeform textbox used to display justification information for the action.
Purchase Order completion, On Time or Late.
The Agency-determined Code for a Major Program within that Agency. For an Indefinite Delivery Vehicle, this may be the name of a Government Wide Acquisition Vehicle (GWAC), (e.g., ITOPS or COMMITS).
The Manager Code is a unique two-character, alphanumeric identifier associated with the Manager of the Buyer who is definied in the associated Buyer field.
Refers to Multiple Award Schedule (MAS) Program.
Identifies the maximum Order allowed under the Contract.
Identifies the maximum dollar amount that can be applied to any line of the Purchase Order.
Identifies the largest Order (in dollars) that may be placed against the Contract.
Two-character Code that specifies the Program or Office with which the Purchase is associated. MOP Codes define the policies of the Program or Office to which the Purchase is subject.
Identifies the minimum Order allowed under the Contract.
Identifies the smallest Order (in dollars) that may be placed against the Contract.
The only option will likely be "New," indicating that you're creating a new Contract Modification. You may see a sequential list of prior Contract Modifications depending on your access.
Mods from Procurement use the following groups: PO, PA, PN. ACO Mods use the group AA, AO, and AN.
Status of the MAS Contract Mods.
Provides the Modification number associated with the Contract. These numbers are applied sequentially, in the order that Mods are initiated.
Provides a sequential list of the Mods associated with the active Contract.
Indicates the Method of Purchase Code. Note that the specific Codes are available in the Code Caddy.
Used to enter a string of characters that correspond to the initial characters of the MOP Description.
Refers to the Material Safety Data Sheets Codes that identify the potentially hazardous materials that will be called for under the Contract.
North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Codes are used by the government to classify business establishments according to type of economic activity.
North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Codes are used by the government to classify business establishments according to type of economic activity.
North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Codes are used by the government to classify business establishments according to type of economic activity.
North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Codes are used by the government to classify business establishments according to type of economic activity.
If a Mod has caused the Estimated Award Value to change, the new Value is entered here.
Enter the predefined Notes that will be included in the Purchase Orders.
Codes used in the Order Writing Process to display Contract level Notes on the Purchase Order.
Provides summary information of a particular NSN across fiscal years.

ORS is a web-based application that is used for Offer Registration, Tracking, and Awarding Contracts from GSA Schedules. It is the initial entry point where Contracts begin their lifecycle through the FSS-19 system. ORS is used by all Federal Acquisition Service (FAS) Centers as the standard Procurement system.

ORS is a web-based application that is used for Offer Registration, Tracking, and Awarding Contracts from GSA Schedules. It is the initial entry point where Contracts begin their lifecycle through the FSS-19 system. ORS is used by all Federal Acquisition Service (FAS) Centers as the standard Procurement system.

ORS is a web-based application that is used for Offer Registration, Tracking, and Awarding Contracts from GSA Schedules. It is the initial entry point where Contracts begin their lifecycle through the FSS-19 system. ORS is used by all Federal Acquisition Service (FAS) Centers as the standard Procurement system.
Identifies whether the Report will display Paper or Electronic Offers.
Identifies the number of Proposals received from Vendors regarding the Solicitation.

Indicates the Office to which an employee is Assigned, or the Office responsible for Administering a Contract. Office symbols are three to four-letter abbreviations used to specify various Offices throughout GSA.
The Prodiction Plan will specify the date the Contract should be Awarded. Note here if it was Awarded On Time or Late according to the specifications provided in the Production Plan.

A web accessible Contract Management system used by FAS's Supplier Management Division. The system is used by Industrial Operations Analysts (IOAs) and Administrative Contracting Officers (ACOs) to document Contractor Assistance Visits (CAVs) and to prepare Contractor Report Cards.
This is the DUNS, DUNS Supplier Number and/or address.
Indicates whether the Contractor Requested this Mod or GSA has Initiated it.

Full and Open Competition allows all Vendors to participate in a Procurement, and is the standard Procurement type used to compete a Contract. Here, identify if another means beside Full & Open Competition is being used, and the Authority that allows such a restriction on competition. This is a Solicitation value and cannot be changed after the Contract is Loaded.
Packing Facility Codes are used to determine packaging location.
Indicates the address where payment for services rendered should be sent. Note that this is where you identify if such an address has changed or remains unchanged.
Indicates whether this is subject to Performance Based Service Contract requirements.

Procurement Contracting Officer (PCO) - is the only person who can bind the United States government to a Contract with a Vendor, limited to the extent of the authority delegated by the head of the Agency.
The area in which the Contracting Officer will provide his or her rationale for Approving or Rejecting the Modification Request.
Performance Based Services Contracts are used when payment to the Contractor is tied to specific performance measurements.
The Performance Oriented Packaging Code to be used in the Order.
Identifies the Primary Performance Place where work will be performed, and sometimes whether or not it has changed as a result of a Modification.
The day on which you would like the Report to begin.
The day on which you would like the Report to end.
Will sum all of the costs associated with the Purchase.
Select the date on which the Purchase Order is being processed.
Enter the total dollar amount associated with the Purchase Order.
Identifies the mailing address, which may be applicable if different than the DUNS (C).
Identifies the Principle Place of Performance associated with the Requisition.
Identifies the ZIP Code of the Principle Place of Performance.
Identifies whether the Procurement took place in a foreign country or the United States.
This is the number of days that the Procurement officials have had up to this point to review Offers and make a Contract Award.
Used if the Modification results in a reduction in the Offeror's Contract prices.
The Prime Error is used to search for and identify all of the Requisitions that have not been processed for a particular reason.
Product Service Codes (PSCs) consist of four alphanumeric characters that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall.
Product Service Codes (PSCs) consist of four alphanumeric characters that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall.
Product Service Codes (PSCs) consist of four alphanumeric characters that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall.
The Prime Error is used to search for and identify all of the Requisitions that have not been processed for a particular reason.
The shorthand title used for a GWAC or other Contracting Program. Examples include COMMITS, ITOPS, and SEWP.
The total dollar amount associated with the Project.
Freeform textbox used to create a name for the Project being created.

Product Service Codes (PSCs) consist of four alphanumeric characters that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall. This field identifies the Product Service Code associated with the Requisition.
Product Service Codes (PSCs) cosist of four alphanumeric characters that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall.
Product Service Codes (PSCs) cosist of four alphanumeric characters that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall.

Product Service Codes (PSCs) consist of four alphanumeric character that identify high-level categories under which a Vendor's Products or Services may fall.
Identifies the maximum quantity associated with ordering under the Contract.
Identifies the minimum quantity associated with ordering under the Contract.
Identifies the quantity of goods being Requested.
Select a Recovering Material Clause when needed.
Depending on the selection made in Type, you will be provided different reasons to explain performing this Modification.
The date on which the Mod was Recieved.
Freeform textbox that allows entry of miscellaneous information pertaining to the Requisition.
The Report Office is a single letter designation used to identify the new user's primary location.
The Report Office is a single letter designation used to identify the new user's primary location. Here, it may be auto-populated based on the Report Office you are signed in to.

Indicates whether you want to view a Report identifying Debarred or Suspended Contractors. Debarred implies the Company is no longer allowed to work with the government while suspended Companies are only temporarily banned from working with the government.
The individual - whether from the government or the Contractor - who has Requested the Modification be Registered.

Requisitions are quick government-to-government transfers that allow Agencies to acquire a broad range of products, supplies, and equipment. They are each provided numbers consisting of ten alphanumeric characters.
This button is used to send information to Security and receive the Defined Rights..

The Pre-Negotiation Clearance Panel (PNCP) is a process whereby Offers may be subjected to an audit prior to Contract Award. Though this audit is performed externally to the system, it was determined that PNCP information should be captured during the Offer and Modification evaluation process.
The Reporting Office whose Contracts or Modifications you wish to view.
Used to filter Report results by Reporting Office.
Enter a Schedule number to tailor your search results.
Select a depot from the list.
Search By: AAC - Activity Address Code Starts With
A six-digit Code assigned to Vendors when their account is established with GSA. Used for a variety of purposes and is mandatory on all FEDSTRIP formats.
A four-character string used to create a Solicitation number.
Used to identify if a Service or Commodity is being Procured through this Purchase Order.
Auto-populated field, indicates whether a Service or Commodity is being Procured under the Contract.
This is the date on which the CO/CS Approved the SF-30 associated with the Modification.

Identifies whether the goods are going to be shipped or delivered. Shipping implies that a third party will be responsible for the transportation of the Product. Delivery implies that the Contractor will transport the Product to the required location.
This field will be used when a change to the shipment delivery value in the Contract is needed.
Schedule Input Program - a proprietary software program provided by GSA to assist Contract holders with uploading their electronic catalogue.
Used to send the information to Security and receive the Defined Rights.
If applicable, an alternate NSN to be used should this Item be unavailable.
This field is used to indicate whether or not the new user is a Supervisor.
Identification of the new user's Supervisor. The Supervisor may be selected from a list of Supervisors according to the user's Office symbol. If not found, enter the email address of the Supervisor.
Identifies the Supplier's DUNS number under the Contract. Must be active in SAM (formerly CCR).
Enables the user to search for the DUNS number of the Contractor who will serve as the supplier of the goods under this Purchase Order.
Indicates whether a Commodity or Service being Requisitioned.
Indicates whether a Contract has been synopsized and posted to FBO or another site, notifying Vendors of the Contract's existence.
Solicitation description posted to FBO or another site, notifying Vendors of the Contract's existence.
Indicates whether the country is subject to the Trade Agreement Act.
Identifies the tex associated with the Purchase under the Requisition.
Indicates whether the Report will sum cycle time at the Office or Acquisition Center level.
Indicates the pricing structure of the Purchase Order, (e.g. Firm Fixed Price, Labor Hour, etc.).
Provides a list of 12+ Modification types to choose from.
Identifies the type of inspection, if any, that will be performed upon delivery of the Product.
NSN level Type of Item Identification.
Set-asides are used to target specific socio-economic business types (woman-owned, HubZone, veteran-owned, etc.). This is a Solicitation value and cannot be changed after the Contract is loaded.
Various types of units that will be used as the basis for processing or requesting goods in the Requisition.
Identifies the number of units per cube.
Two-character Code used to identify the unit or measurement associated with the NSN.
Identifies the number of units per pack.
Identifies the number of units per pallet.
Identifies the number of units per shipping container.
Identifies the weight of a unit.
This dropdown menu is used to select the user whose access rights you want to change.

Identify if the user is a Procurement Contracting Officer, Administrative Contracting Officer, Industrial Operations Analyst, etc. This informs the type of access the user will receive when working with FSS Online.
Distinguishable from User Role in that it provides the level of access you will receive once assigned a role, (e.g., a Supervisor will typically receive more access than Procurement Staff).
Identifies the highest Contract dollar amount the user can sign off on. This value must be included for PCOs, PCSs, and ACOs.
A unique number assigned to each Contracting Officer who holds a warrant. This is required for PCOs. Some ACOs may also be warranted.
Identifies the Agency or Agencies that can use the Contract to obtain Products or Services.
Used to allocate cost prince based on a delivery zone.
